lines.text: ["Sweet Home Alabama" plays in background]
Define irony. Bunch of idiots dancing on a plane to a song made famous by a band that died in a plane crash.
Put... the bunny... back... in the box.
Are you sick?
Why do you ask?
You look sick.
I am sick.
Do you take medicine?
There is no medicine for what I have.

[talking about Billy Bedlam]
He's a font of misplaced rage. Name your cliché; mother held him too much or not enough, last picked at kickball, late night sneaky uncle, whatever. Now he's so angry moments of levity actually cause him pain; gives him headaches. Happiness, for that gentleman, hurts.

What if I told you insane was working fifty hours a week in some office for fifty years at the end of which they tell you to piss off; ending up in some retirement village hoping to die before suffering the indignity of trying to make it to the toilet on time? Wouldn't you consider that to be insane?

[to Larkin]
Sorry boss, but there's only two men I trust. One of them's me. The other's not you.
Contingency plans for something like this don't exist! A situation like this has never been contemplated.
Well, you better start contemplating, because this is a situation that needs to get UN-FUCKED, RIGHT NOW!
It smells like someone shit in your mouth.
He told me he loved me.
[Holding a gun up to the head of a stuffed pink bunny]
Make a move and the bunny gets it.

[about his Corvette]
Beautiful? Sunsets are beautiful. Newborn babies are beautiful. This... this is fucking spectacular!
kidnapping, robbery, murder, extortion.
Foxtrot Charlie, perimeter is secure. You are clear to release.

His name is Cyrus Grissom, A.K.A. Cyrus the Virus. Thirty-nine years old, twenty-five of them spent in our institutions. But he's bettered himself inside. Earned two degrees, including his juris doctorate. He also killed eleven fellow inmates, incited three riots, and escaped twice. Likes to brag that he killed more men than cancer.
Okay, open wide. Lift your tongue.
Cyrus is a poster child for the criminally insane. He's a true product of the system.
What's that supposed to mean?
[to Sims]
What is he, one of these sociology majors who thinks we're responsible for breeding these animals?
No, but I can point a few fingers if it would make you feel comfortable.

[upon seeing Malloy's Corvette Stingray attached to the flying plane]
On any other day, that might seem strange.
Where are you going with my plane, Cyrus?
We're going to Disney Land.
You're lying, Cyrus.
So are you, Vince.
[singing mockingly]
Ohh... nothing makes me sadder than the agent lost his blader in the... aaaiirrrplane.
[Larking throws the headset he's using]
"The degree of civilization in a society can be judged by observing its prisoners." Dostevsky said that... after doin' a little time.
"Fuck you!" Cyrus Grissom said that after putting a bullet in my agent's head, okay?

[getting Poe's attention]
Yee-haw! What's on your mind, Hillbilly?

What was I thinking about? Oh, yeah, "yee-haw", that's right. I was just wondering what a black militant - that would be you - was doin' takin' orders from a white boy on a power trip? Don't you think that's strange?
It's a means to an end, my white friend. A means to an end. See, I's can play house nigger tills we get to where we're goin'. And then, the Day of the Dog begins.

[to Johnny 23]
I despise rapists. For me, you're somewhere between a cockroach and that white stuff that accumulates at the corner of your mouth when you're really thirsty. But, in your case, I'll make an exception.

[to Sims]
We pick up Mr. Cindino in Carson City. From then until the plane hits Alabama, we've got two hours to get him to talk. We got you a seat right next to him, and he's known to be somewhat garrulous in the company of thieves.
Garrulous? What the fuck is garrulous?
That would be loquacious, verbose, effusive. How about "chatty"?

[to Devers]
What's with Dictionary Boy?
"Thesaurus Boy" I think is more appropriate.

They somehow managed to get every creep and freak in the universe onto this one plane. And then somehow managed to let them take it over. And then somehow managed to stick us right smack in the middle.
Thanks, Poe. You've proven to be a most useful mammal.
Many hands make light work. My daddy taught me that.
Ya know what my daddy taught me?
What's that?
Nothing.
Self-educated man.
What's up, man. So, you Swamp Thing?
That's right.
Flyin' the plane?
That's right.
It's amazing the shit you white trash know.
That's right.

[about Vince Larkin being unreachable]
Of course you're having trouble reaching him. He's off saving the rain forest, or recycling his sandals or some shit.
You lost your mind?
According to my last psych evaluation, yes.

[Poe and Cyrus stopped Johnny from going for Guard Bishop]
Do you fly, Johnny?
No.
You keep that in mind when you look at her. Because if your dick jumps out of your pants, you jump off this plane.
If you can't trust a South American drug lord, who can you trust, huh?
[silence]
That was a joke.
I'm glad you told me.
One girl, I drove through three states wearing her head as a hat.

[tosses a folder onto a table]
Here's the jacket on Cameron Poe. His wife's on the way here now. A U.S. Ranger, highly decorated. Did a litte hellraising when he was a kid, but nothing serious.
Explain to me why any of this matters.
our guard Falzon said a convict named Cameron Poe planted Sims's tape recorder on him.
[brightens]
These are interesting facts. You do the math on this... and we got an ally on that plane.
We let you out, you gonna play nice, Billy?

[smiles viciously]
Probably not.

[smashing Johnny 23's head into the cage wall on each word]
DON'T. TREAT. WOMEN. LIKE. THAT!
[referring to Malloy's Corvette falling from the plane]
I know a good body shop in Fresno if it's insured.
I was bored with that car anyway.
It worked out nicely, then.
Guard Falzon?
What?

[in squeaky voice]
Oh, stewardess? Stewardess? What's the in-flight movie today?
Well, I think you'll like it, Cyrus. It's called "I'll Never Make Love to a Woman on the Beach Again", and it's preceded by the award-winning short, "No More Steak for Me, Ever".
[Guard Falzon walks away chuckling]

[mumbles]
Funny fucker, aren't ya?

[singing in the crashing plane]
He's got the who-ole wo-orld in his hands...
Considering my audience, I'm going to make this very quick and very simple.
[points to objects in the sand]
This is the boneyard, this is the hanger, this is our plane.

[points]
What's that?
That's a rock.
[knocks it out of the way]
Okay.
I'm DEA! D'you know what the fuck that means?
It means you're the most crooked nigger on this plane!
I don't know how to tell ya this, Cyrus, but we are three white guys short. Or as they say in Ebonics, "We be fucked."
Ladies and Gentlemen, this is your captain speaking. I have the only gun on board. Welcome to Con Air.
Do you know what I am?
Ugly all day?
that I love her. She's my hummin'bird. But, I couldn't leave a fallen man behind. You'll do that for me, won't you, Larkin?
Sure, I will. What are you gonna do for me?
What do you think I'm gonna do? I'm gonna save the fuckin' day!
Just so's ya know, Marshal Larkin, there's now three people I trust.
Am I one of them?
[they shake hands]
He brought a gun on the plane!
If I knew the way you guys run things I would have told him to bring a fuckin' UZI on board!

[taking daughter's picture back]
Told you I'd get that back.
Fuck you, trailer trash!
HEY! My mama lives in a trailer! Now put those on! I just saved your life.

Nathan Jones, A.K.A. Diamond Dog. Former general of the Black Guerillas. He blew up a meeting of the National Rifle Association saying, and I quote, "They represented the basest negativity of the white race." He wrote a book in prison called, "Reflections in a Diamond Eye." New York Times called it a wakeup call for the black community. They're talking to Denzel for the movie.
Where's the plane, Francisco?
I don't know, have patience.
The last guy who told me to have patience, I burned him down and bagged his ashes.
My, my. As I look around, I see a lot of celebrities among us. I see eleven Current Affairs, two Hard Copies and
[looking in Diamond Dog's cage]

a genuine Geraldo interviewee. But, I gotta tell you gentlemen, none of this impresses me. Becuase we have rules on this aircraft, and they're gonna be enforced. It's a lot like kindergarten, you'll keep your hands to yourself, you'll keep the decibel level down, and if any of you should feel the need to scream, spit or bite, you'll get the treatment.

[spits on Falzon's feet]
Fuck you, pig.

[to the other guards]
Gag and bag this Nazi muffin.
[hits the con and the other guards use tape and put a breathable bag over his head]

See, this kinda thing puts me in a foul mood. These rules will be enforced. If there's a hint of trouble, if any of you so much as passes gas in my direction it offends my delicate nasal passages, your testicles will become my personal property.
Nice jet. You can take Cindino and leave the rest to rot for all I care. You fire that weapon, twenty pissed-off prisoners are gonna hear it. Comprende, Ese?
[Cindino's man screws a silencer to his gun, and scoffs]
Well, hooray for the sounds of *fucking* silence!
The last Mohican is burning, man!
Well, we told you today's flight would be special. That's William Bedford, aka "Billy Bedlam."
The mass murderer?
The same. He caught his wife in bed with another man. Left her alone, drove four towns over to his wife's family's house. Killed her parents, her brothers, her sisters, even her dog.

Someone alerted the authorities at Carson city, someone told them about our Lerner rendezvous, someone even killed poor Billy Bedlam. Now, could this all be coincidence? Perhaps. But then someone went and tied a rope to our plane. So, I ask you what is going on? And I answer. We have a traitor in our midst. Now how do we flush a traitor?
[pulls guard Bishop out of her cell and puts his gun to her head]
I don't know but at the count of three I will find out who is on my team and who is not. That would be one, two...

[pushes Poe out of the way as Poe was standing up to confess]
Wait! It was me. It was me.
Don't listen to him, man. T-The insulin, it made him crazy.
You have been near death the entire trip?
Yeah, motherfucker, it was me.
Nah, he's-he's flipped out, man. He's nuts.
That's pretty clever, huh, bitch?
[Cyrus shoots Baby O in the stomach]
Jesus!

[shouting]
No, that's clever!

[as he's trying to undress Guard Bishop]
When you wake up, Bishop, I'll be Johnny 24.

[after killing Bedlam in self-defense, looking disappointed at Bedlam's corpse]
Why couldn't you put the bunny back in the box?
[first lines]
Rangers lead the way.
[Poe returns to his seat after killing Billy Bedlam, feeling depressed although he acted in self-defence]
Two went down, one came up.
Wasn't my fault.
Well, you don't have to tell me. Most murders are crimes of necessity rather than desire. But the great ones, Dahmer, Gacy, Bundy... they did it because it excited them.

[angrily]
Don't you... I got nothing in common with them, with you. Don't you talk to me! They were insane.

Now you're talking semantics. What if I told you insane was working fifty hours a week in some office for fifty years... at the end of which they tell you to piss off? Ending up in some retirement village... hoping to die before suffering the indignity of trying to make it to the toilet on time. Wouldn't you consider that to be insane?
Murdering thirty people, semantics or not, is insane!

[smiles]
One girl... I drove through three states wearing her head as a hat.
It's my daughter's birthday today. So please feel free not to share everything with me.
[Cyrus is about to burn Cindino alive]
Cy...
...onara!
Christ in a cartoon.
Shit, that's Garland Greene man.
The Marietta Mangler.
That skinny little man butchered thirty-something people up and down the eastern seaboard. They say the way he killed those people, makes the Manson Family look like the Partridge Family.
Well, he's on the right flight.
We got a problem here with a corpse.
Uh-huh.
Yeah, it fell outta the sky. I don't think he's an astronaut.
What's this got to do with me?
It's got your name written all over it.
You didn't mean that "dirty nigger crackhead" shit, did you?
Give me that gun.
[takes the gun]
Hell yes, I meant it.
You with me or do you need me to draw it in crayon like usual?
That gun work?
Yeah.
Then shoot that piece of shit!
[last lines]
New shooter coming out, new shooter. Does the new shooter feel lucky? Well, does he?
Yes... yes he does.

[boasts that he got his nickname according to the number of women he raped]
They'd call me Johnny 600 if they knew the truth.

[to Agent Sims]
You know, the next time you choose a human shield, you're better off not picking a two-bit negro crackhead.

[on why he's going back to the plane]
I can't trade a friend's life for my own, Larkin, that's all.
You got a friend on board? See, I knew I was right about you.

[to Cyrus]
You ain't getting near my daughter! Buckle up!

[Holding 3 guards at gun point, singing]
Swing low, sweet chariot, comin' for to carry me home...
What's going on here?
It's time to off the pigs.
You can't.
Why not?
They're hostages, we need them.

[Points the gun at Poe]
Now why the fuck do you care?
Hey, man. I can think of anything I'd like...
[Kicks the first guard]
...better, than to put a...
[Kicks the second guard]
...bullet, into the brain-base here of every one of these...
[Kicks the third guard]

FUCKERS! But the fact of the matter is how well do you know this Cindino? I don't know him that well, myself. Just what I read. Like how he firebombed that Senator's yacht with 2 of his cousins on board. Now, why would think he'd sweat about eliminating some hired guns after they have served their purpose, now think about that.

[Coming in]
What exactly are we discussing here?
Poe don't want me to off the pigs.

[to Poe]
Well, I can understand Nathan's feeling about killings guards and my own proclivities are well known facts of penal lore. What I want to know is, why you have any opinion at all?
Hey, Cyrus. It's your barbecue man, and it tastes good. But I was just explaining to Mr.
[Points to Diamond Dog]
"Dog" here that if it was "my" barbecue, I would wait for that ol' jumbo jet in the sky before I start killing my only leverage.
Shut the fuck up.
Don't you want to get high and get laid, shit.

[Picks up a guard]
Oh, fuck this.

[Seeing Diamond Dog about to kill the guard]
Put the gun down. *Put the gun down, Nathan!* Poe's right. We're going to plan B. We're going to get a tractor and a fuel truck, get everybody here, and we're going to dig the plane out.
[Poe winks at Diamond Dog]
[Baby-O calls guard Bishop to get insulin shot]
Hey, lady!
Lady's a dog in a Walt Disney movie. My name is Bishop. Guard Bishop to you.
Well, I gotta be gettin' my shot before we go gettin' on some aeroplane, Guard Bishop.
What's your name?
O'Dell. They didn't give me my shot last night.
Okay, you're diabetic? Alright, your insulin's on board. We'll give it to you in flight.
[to the pilot whom he is holding at gunpoint]
And if you say a word about this over the radio, the next wings you see will belong to the flies buzzing over your rotting corpse!

[refering to Garland Greene]
What's wrong with him?
My first thought would be... a lot.
What can I do?
Take this.
[hands Sally a gun and stuffs ammo down his shirt]
Go into the boneyard, yeah? Anybody gets through, you scratch their eyes out.
You got it!
I got a bad feeling, son. I'm feeling like maybe I'm not supposed to make it.
You gonna make it.

[over radio]
Cyrus Grissom, this is special agent Vince Larkin. We will shoot the plane down if you do not respond now.
All I can think about is like... there ain't no God, like he don't exist.
[Poe gets up and starts walking away]
Hey! Where you going?
I'm going to show you God does exist.
Don't they have a way of tracking these planes?
Oh, yeah. It's called a transponder. Every plane's got one, Cindino.

[sarcastic]
Swamp, where is the transponder?

[looks at the empty bay]
Ah! Where, indeed?
Not only did you not save this dude's life, you done made best friends with Cyrus the damn Virus!
Well, Baby-O, it's not exactly mai-thais and yatzee out here but... let's do it!
[runs through hail of gunfire, explosions, etc]

[searches Poe and finds his picture of his daughter]
What's this shit?
That's my daughter.
Well, I don't care if it's the weeping mama o' Christ, there's no personal possessions on this airplane.
Just as long as you know, I'll be getting that back at some point.

[raising his voice]
Are you telling me what I'm gonna be doing here, numb nuts?
How am I doing, son?
You're doing fine.
Yeah, but like at this new prison you're goin' to, who's gonna watch your back?
The Brothers got my back. You know what I'm sayin'?
How you doin', man? Pinball Parker. Armed robber, arsonist, dope fiend. Hey, I'm a hell of a nice guy, it's just I got caught.

[deadpan]
Aw, shucks.
Before I kill you, Poe, I just wanted you to know that the last thing that little Casey Poe ever gets to smell will be my stinking breath.

[desperately trying to start a truck]
Come on, you stinking piece of shit car!

[to Poe]
Chicken shit. 'Cause of pussies like you we lost Vietnam. I'll tell you that.
